snippet: Dorothy Mackaill, a star in silent films and early talkies, is the subject of a DVD double bill from Warner Brothers, featuring two pre-code movies: “Office Wife” (1930) and “Party Husband” (1931).
abstract: Dave Kehr reviews DVD of 1931 William A Wellman film Safe in Hell.
lead_paragraph: Dorothy Mackaill, a star in silent films and early talkies, is the subject of a DVD double bill from Warner Brothers, featuring two pre-code movies: “Office Wife” (1930) and “Party Husband” (1931).

headline.seo: Dorothy Mackaill’s ‘Safe in Hell’ and Others on DVD
headline.main: A Short Career in Lurid Hollywood
headline.print_headline: A Short Career in Lurid Hollywood
